info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL LOUISA AND CENTRAL FLUVANNA COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Lake Monticello, or 10 miles west of Palmyra, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lake Monticello around 315 PM EDT. Troy around 335 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Nahor, Bybee, Zion Crossroads, Antioch, Cunningham, Union Mills, Wildwood, and Scottsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
